text: Doesn't work with Chromes "Grouping of Tabs" feature unfortunately. Otherwise great extension.
Best extenstion ever! But stopped working after the last Chrome update. I suppose it fails to work normally with active usage of new synced tab groups. Please can you check it?

I use this cycle feature so much, I try to mimic this feature in other software I use to keep the muscle memory. Would love to have this in ObsidianMD, VSCode, etc. Really helps me zip around. This extension has earned a dedicated button on my mouse on desktop pc and trackpad gesture on laptop.
Excellent extension. Unfortunately it doesn't work with the Chrome's new "Tab Group" feature. Will change to a 5 out of 5 once it does.
Please update the code to work for across the group, the extension does'nt work for group feature introduced recently in chrome. It will be a great help if u do so.
Seems to not working for some website anymore after recent Chrome update.

Three stars, as the extension itself works flawlessly.

However ATTN: The author tracks installation and update and has Google Analytics included as well (see `background.js` in the repository for yourself).
"Bad smell", as he doesn't point to this fact nowhere, "VERY bad smell".

Better use the fork called "Open Last Tab", where this tracking code is removed.
Next to ad-block, and a password manager, this is an essential extension for me.
exactly what I need. Many thanks to the developer!
Awesome

The tab order is often incorrect. I'm only using the "slow switch" function. Going backwards usually (but not always) works as expected. But going forwards almost never does. It usually switches to different windows and/or completely unrelated, long-unused tabs. Perhaps it would help to explain the exact logic used for deciding the tab order. Currently, it seems roughly random to me.

Stopped working. Uninstalled, reinstalled. Now it works again. (New version? Not sure.)

Anyway, good extension. :-)

Great extension, but when loading any chat forum that's based on the Discourse plugin, the page fails to load (it rejects a lot of inline scripts). This made it unusable for me, as many of the resources I visit are chat forums.
I've been using this for four years now and can't imagine life without it. I just started using a new machine and thought Chrome was broken until I realized I hadn't installed this extension yet!
This extension is super useful, it does something that Chrome should have being doing out of the box for years (like Firefox for example)
Does the job because Chrome doesn't by default. 10/10 always install in all my chrome-based browsers that don't have LRU tab cycling
Works perfectly and for me is indispensible for Chrome since I can't set the behavior with built in controls like Firefox. Well done.
Great work! Simple and just does what it should

Do what is expected!

Could be better, e.g. show preview of tabs you are cycling. But given current standards and there is absolutely nothing. This is work of genius... Chrome menu More tools> Extensions: choose 3 dashes> Keyboard shortcut... Find this extension to assign shortcut to it.
I choose Alt+Q; it works perfectly and help me to jump between 2 recent tabs quickly.
Cool stuff!
Can I change the extension icon? It doesn't look expressive on the taskbar.
I tried quite a few other solutions in the past, and found this one works the best!
Using it all the time
good job! made my life easier
one of the best extensions I have, and a great time saver
I've been using it for years. Super helpful and simple. My only question is why is this not standard Chrome behaviour?
That's what I want. Thank you!
No frills extension. Does exactly what it advertises.
Exactly what I need to simple dumb last tabs switch! No idea why this still not in Chrome default code!

It's the best one out there. I know it's for 'clut'ing but it would also be nice to have the ability to alt-q repeatedly to scroll through all the tabs much like in Windows. Well done. I've used this extension for at least a couple years on several gmail accounts.

I was using the other more popular extension (Jason's Recent Tabs) until that one updated in April and required a lot more permissions for no obvious reasons.

Switched to this one and got the same functionality with few permissions asked.
good extension
Excellent! It does exactly what it should do without asking for unnecessary permissions.

Wonderful extension, and with some Stackoverflow it's possible to make it run from Ctrl+Tab hotkey, but is there an option to make newly created tabs count as "most recent"? So when I open tabs in background, I can easily switch to it by pressing Ctrl+Tab?
Super helpful! I love that you can set different shortcuts for switching between last 2 tabs vs. going backwards through all the tabs you recently visited

Great extension, and better than all the alternatives I tried. I don't know if it's due to a recent update or just my imagination, but I seem to notice that the delay for toggling between more than two tags has gone up, so I often end up accidentally jumping to a third or fourth tab if I hit the shortcut twice in a row. Perhaps the developer should consider letting the user set this delay.
It's Working! Great!
Love it
Simple, YET helpful!
Cannot imagine browsing without this extension. Such a great time saver when you have too may tabs open (which is inevitably always).
Thank you! Mimics the handy Firefox feature to switch to the previous tab using the keyboard.
This extension hasn't been updated since 2016 and no longer works.
It does just what I needed, and it is really easy to get used to "ALT+W" shortcut. If you usually open a lot of tabs it will increase by far your agility to switch between them.

Works great, but don't understand the appeal of 'rapid' switching backward. I wish as long as ctrl is pressed, it would continue backwards every time tab is pressed instead of having to press it 'rapidly'. Like how the app-switcher for macOS works. You don't need to be 'rapid' about switching through the MRU list... That is just silly. But solid extension otherwise.
just i need this!! Thanks!
perfect complement to 'go to playing tab' if you have multiple chrome windows/tabs open
This is exactly what I was loking for. Thank you Harshay.

Love those one purpose nicely integrated extensions. 
Simple and efficient functionality with big productivity improvements.
+1

If there's only one extension I could install, this would be the one lol. Why not treat browsers the same as OS? I'd be cool with it if a dev could give a good explanation (like technical limitation, or UI study) but just "we won't do it" is nuts!

This extension is mandatory for developers, who are used to this behavior in IDEs. There's no way back once you get used to this.

New issue after the 2023 Nov Chrome update: It doesn't work for tabs that are in Group and have Save Group turned on. 
--
It works. The only issue is that the rendering of the browsing history is delayed by 1 or 2 sec, and it didn't keep track of Alt key. So if I press and release Alt+S twice within 2 second, it will not switch between current page and the last page. And, if I press Alt+S and releasing S but holding Alt, it will not continue cycling to the previous page when I press S again. ... Show more
this is the only working extension i found

Yay!! Finally an MRU tab extension that actually works.

If you're using Windows then you can map Ctrl+Tab to Alt+W using autohotkey.

Add these lines to your autohotkey script:

#IfWinActive ahk_class Chrome_WidgetWin_1
^Tab::Send !w  ; Map Ctrl+Tab to Alt+W
#IfWinActive

Modifying the Chrome Preferences file didn't work for me. I sync my Chrome preferences, so every time Chrome restarted it overwrote my modifications to the Preferences file.
After testing some others this one installed and worked right away. Awesome

I don't get how native Chrome doesn't have this? I feel like maybe I'm missing it and its there? This extension is just too useful. I often have a lot of tabs open and then start doing work between two open google docs and this is perfect allowing me to switch quickly between the two. Great job!
you can use both the normal ctrl+tab hotkey for normal tab switching and alt+w for last used tabs

Simply does not work, sorry,  It is selected to work in More Tools>Extensions but ctrl+tab still only toggles thru all the tabs vs.   btwn the current tab and the  most recently  access tab, which is fitting if you have many tabs open.

 Of course, unlike Firefox ESR with the TabMixPlux extension, you also cannot enable multiple tab rows.

 I also have Ctrl+Tab MRU installed but which also does not enable this toggling,    unlike Firefox.
It would be nice to have a list of the last used pages when alt+w is pressed so the user can easily choose the tab

Ohmagerd this is amazing! Does just what it is supposed to. Especially good when I have multiple tabs open and it isn't obvious what some of them are just from the tab name, meaning I can't remember which was my previous tab. This shortcut sends me straight there.
Great addon !!! thanks

Very very useful if you get lost in the sea of tabs of your chrome window. So useful I was compelled to write a review on how useful it is and I don't write many reviews on the usefulness of chrome extensions that are actually useful. Useful.
Supports flipping back to tabs in different windows, which "Toggle Switch Recent Last Tabs" doesn't.
Awesome.

I needed to quickly switch between two tabs (occurs frequently when I have loads of tabs open but only need two tabs for the task at hand) and this add-on's Alt+W feature does just that: switches between last two tabs alternatively so I don't have to use the mouse to scroll through 20 open tabs to find the ones I need)
Great extension, thank you very much for this! Can you do one for Microsoft Edge? That'd be awesome!

Out of several similar extensions, this one is the only one that works. The only problem I had is that for the first time you install it, after I closed Chrome, it cleared all of my opened tabs. But later when I close and reopen Chrome, all off the tabs restoration functionality works as expected. At least a warning could be given. I use "Continue where you left off" option in Chrome.
Simply works! Cool!

(1) The "ALT + S: Normal switch" is available in Chrome already. No need to do it.

(2) No list of recent tabs which is shown when I need to pick up a tab that is 3-4 tabs away.

So, useless.

In love with this extension, period. Thank you!!!

this + viumium = gold

Does exactly what its supposed too. You can change the options in the settings

I can't assign ctrl-tab to this extension, which isn't the extension's fault as far as I know but it's a universal key combination for switching tabs within an app so it should be used.

Also, this extension doesn't mimic alt-tab functionality. Performing successive alt-s key combinations just cycles through the tabs in order of history rather than flip back and forth between the two most recent tabs.
It was much better for me earlier. But the last release does not work with more than 2 tabs. Why so really? It become useless for me since.
perfect!

Just what I was looking for to restore the prior tab switching capability to toggle between two tabs, and also shift to a new tab easily using the keyboard only.
Originally it was as noted in another review by Sergei, where Ctrl+Tab+Tab vs Ctrl+Tab, Ctrl+Tab are distinguished by toggling, or stepping through the tab sequence to pick a new one.
This doesn't work quite that way, but it's just as good.  I set alt-Q for the toggle, and alt-W for forward, and alt-S for reverse.

Given that the chrome extension API either does or soon will support binding to Ctrl-TAB again, I'd much rather bind to that.  I have no muscle memory for ALT-W and ALT-S, particularly since I don't type on a qwerty keyboard.
Thanks a ton. I increased my productivity because of this!!

Good so far (installed 10 minutes ago). In combination with Tabs Outliner and TabTabSearch, two extensions which help quickly save, suspend and restore tabs and the other to quickly focus any given tab by simple omnibar search. Finally feels like I can manage decently having so many tabs (100+ typically) while not killing all resources.
saved lot of time

Simple and reasonably effective. Could use tweaks, like a Windows Alt+tab style list and a more logical way of cycling through tabs (once you're in the middle of cycling with Alt+S, then hitting Alt+W means you cycle back to the beginning of the stack, not the last tab - but maybe that's not such a bad thing). I like...

How did I live without this? and why doesn't google add this to chrome? unless you have 2 screens using tabs is lesser to having 2 windows. if you have a page with reference and an editor, switching back and forth is all you do. I was always looking for "where was that tab" no more... thank you!
Sweet! I use this with Quick Tabs, very nice solution to Chrome's missing tabs functionality.
Works perfectly ! Finally an extension that does this job right ! And I spent quite a bit of time looking for one.
